オプション1:
When Star Man returned to the coastal cave, Square Man was crouched,
groaning. The other two sat and watched him.
"What's wrong?"
"I showed him the red fruit and he doubled over. It's the detoxed red fruit."

"There's this thing where ghosts, because of regrets from life,
try to steal your Word Bless..."
"Hmm. Then maybe he once nearly died from that red fruit."
"Never saw it, but maybe it did happen."
"Haha, I never noticed. What a poker face."
"Let's hide the red fruit where it can't be seen."
They decided to stash the red fruit out of sight.
That night.
As the least they could do, they prepared lots of food for Square Man.

As summer neared on Prolitan Island,
they could harvest mangoes and papayas.
Triangle Man showed Square Man his own bow and arrows.
"Know what this is? It's a bow and arrows."
Square Man watched with interest.
"You use it like this."
Triangle Man loosed an arrow at a target about ten meters away.
<Clang>
A dry sound rang out when it hit the target.

Cautiously handing it to Square Man,
he mimicked and shot at the target too.
<Clang>

"Like riding a bicycle—movements you can't explain how you control—
he can probably still do those."
Star Man said.
That night the four of them played target practice with bows.

At dawn, they awoke to Square Man coughing.
He seemed in such agony he couldn't get up.
He spat blood; his breathing was shallow and rapid.
(Damn it... there's nothing we can do...)
Vim stood nearby.
"You scared me... I didn't notice you at all."
Vim watched Square Man's condition with curiosity.

"It's Square Man. He became a ghost,
then merged with a monster and turned into Red Man."
Vim was expressionless.
"Did you know about Red Man?"
"No."

"They say Red Man dies in a week.
Do you know any way to save him?"
"I don't."
All three stared down at the ground.

Square Man's suffering only worsened;
his groans, coughs, and retching went on and on.
His breathing was ragged; he cried as he struggled.
(Maybe three hours left to live...)
"Let's... put him out of his misery."
Star Man said.
No one answered.
Triangle Man hesitated, then stepped away from Square Man.

Star Man stood, gripping his stone axe in both hands.
Seeing it, Square Man lowered his eyes.
Trapezoid Man and Triangle Man looked away.
But Star Man couldn't swing the axe and sat down.
A few hours later, Square Man died.
"I remember the first time we ate acorns together..."
Star Man recalled giving him acorns in the Bitnavi Forest.
<Rustle>
"Yo, yo."
A man approached from the forest. It was Nes.
"Oh my—(laugh) what's up? (laugh)"
"Go away."
Trapezoid Man said.
"Eeh— (laugh) why can't I be here? (laugh)"
"Square Man died..." Triangle Man said.
"Aww, so sad— (laugh) boo-hoo, boo-hoo— (laugh)"
Nes covered his mouth, crouching to hide his face.
"Nff... nff..."

"Ah-hahaha! Someone died! (laugh)
Party tonight! Maybe I'll drink all day! (laugh)"
Nes laughed so hard his knees buckled and he couldn't stand.
"Why are you laughing?"

"Because none of you are actually sad,
and you're just acting sad. (laugh)"
"Acting...?"

"There's no way you're sad. (laugh)
I mean, look—ahaha—it's obviously a different person. (laugh)"
Nes rolled on the ground, flailing his legs.
"Ahahahaha—pfft—kuk—ah—ahahahaha!"
"Do you know why Square Man died?"

"Nope, not at all. (laugh) I have no idea. (laugh)
Why would I know something like that? (laugh)"
Star Man straddled Nes; with Nes convulsed in laughter, it was easy.
"Tell me what you know."
"I told you, I don't know. (laugh)"
<Bang>

Star Man punched Nes in the face,
then grabbed his head and shook him hard.
"Tell me what you kno-o-ow!!!"
"Hey now, hey now— (laugh)"

"He ate it himself even though I told him to stop.
I said, 'It's called sago palm—eat it and you'll die, so don't.' (laugh)"

"But he went, 'Munch, munch—so tasty, tasty, taaasty,'
and kept eating. (laugh)"
"No way. Square Man knew the red fruit was deadly poison."

"I ke-ept telling him, 'Stop right now,' even while he was eating. (laugh)
Even when I tried to stop him by force, he kept eating. (laugh)"

"He was probably ***, (laugh)
and hey, this guy's *** too. (laugh)"
Nes pointed at Star Man.

"You don't even know? (laugh)
Both his parents are *** too. (laugh)"
"Star Man! Stop!"
At Trapezoid Man's shout, Star Man lowered his raised fist.

Nes was shaking all over—despite his words,
he seemed to be trembling with fear.

"Believe meee— (laugh)
'Everyone says it's deadly poison, but that's a lie,
I'll just tell Gain where you all are'—that's what he said while eating! (laugh)"

"You threatened him: 'If you don't eat one, I'll snitch your location'
then 'Actually, two'—and 'Actually, three'—
changing the conditions to keep making him eat, didn't you?"
Trapezoid Man said.

"No no no, that's not it— (laugh)
I said, 'Okay, I get it—stop—don't eat any more.' (laugh)"

"So then you kept changing it from 'one' to 'two' to 'three'
and forced him to keep eating?"

"C'mon— (laugh) stop making things up. (laugh)
I'd never do something that awful. (laugh)
I said, 'They're around there—go get 'em.' (laugh)"

"And even though Square Man begged you with his life on the line
not to tell Gain where we were,
you went and told him anyway."
"No I didn't— (laugh) I mean I did what the kid asked, didn't I? (laugh)"
Star Man stood up.
"Enough. Get out of here."
When Star Man said that, Nes stood up.
"So cruel, so cruel."
Hands and knees shaking, Nes waved at Square Man.
"Byee— Eat all the sago you want up in heaven! (laugh)"
"Yaaay, someone died— someone died—"
Skipping, Nes vanished into the forest.
<Thud>
Trapezoid Man slammed his fist into the ground.
"See? I told you so!"
"If we'd killed Gain, Square Man wouldn't have had to die!"
Triangle Man said.

They carried the soil soaked with red liquid toward the cliff,
set a stone upon it,
and made it Square Man's grave.
For about a week, they said nothing and quietly worked on the raft.
